msContents.summary:
Nuzhat al-asfār by Muḥammad Samarqandī.
A narrative work which the author based on Kalīla wa-Dimna. Concerned with the dispute between mankind and the animals.

msItem.title: Nuzhat al-asfār
نزهة الاسفار
msItem.incipit: حمدی که مرکب تیزکام وهم سالهای نامعدود بسرحد ابتداء آن نرسد
msItem.explicit: غافل میروی وهیچ اندیشه نیز ترا دامن گیر نمیشود

note.p: Text dedicated to Sulṭān Muḥammad Iskandar al-ThānīʿUthmānī.
Although the catch words match, text appears to be missing between f.34b and f.35a. The beginning of Chapter Twelve ought to appear here.

supportDesc.condition: Some folios patched, particularly at the beginning. Binding warped.

handDesc.handNote: Naskh. Black ink. Rubrication in red.

bindingDesc.p: Binding of leather on pasteboard. Stamped medallion in centre. Panels worn and cracked.

accMat.p: f. 1a Note reads: Bought at Sacender’s saleroom. نزهة الاسفار by محمد سمرقندی for سلطان محمد عثمانی

provenance.p: Formerly part of the collection of the Persian scholar Nathaniel Bland (1803-1865). Bland’s oriental manuscripts were sold through Bernard Quaritch in 1866 to Alexander Lindsay, 25th Earl of Crawford.

acquisition.p: Purchased by Enriqueta Rylands, on behalf of the John Rylands Library, in 1901 from James Ludovic Lindsay, 26th Earl of Crawford.

source.p: Bibliographical description based on an index created by Reza Navabpour circa 1993. Identification of provenance based on manuscript catalogue by Michael Kerney, circa 1890s.

availability.p: The manuscript is available for consultation by any accredited reader, see Becoming a Reader for details. Please contact uml.special-collections@manchester.ac.uk for further information on the availability of this manuscript.
